summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to the FBI, inquiring about updates on travel records for Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein from UK authorities, and confirming whether travel records for a third individual (name redacted) were also requested from CBP for the 1990s.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Her travel records from the UK side are being sought by the US Attorney's Office as part of an investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: His travel records from the UK side are being sought by the US Attorney's Office as part of an investigation.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email, working in the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, following up on travel record requests for Epstein, Maxwell, and another individual.

connections.description: Both are subjects of the same investigation, with their travel records being requested together.

events.title: Email inquiry about travel records
events.description: An AUSA emails the FBI to check for updates on UK travel records for Maxwell and Epstein and to confirm if CBP records for the 1990s for a third individual were requested.

keyFacts: The US Attorney's Office was actively seeking UK travel records for Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein as of April 2021.
The office had previously obtained CBP (Customs and Border Protection) records for Epstein and Maxwell for the 1990s.
The email inquires whether CBP records for a third, redacted individual were also requested for the 1990s, indicating a broader investigative scope.
The correspondence shows ongoing investigative coordination between the US Attorney's Office and the FBI regarding the Epstein/Maxwell case.
